results.title: Training mannikin
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”
Intended mainly for first aid instructors but also of interest to first aid classes, the various ways in which a manikin may be used to train a class to perform both exhaled air resuscitation and closed chest cardiac massage are demonstrated by an instructor and his pupils. Care and maintenance of the manikin is illustrated as well as the hygienic precautions taken to safeguard users.

results.title: Seconds count
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”

A realistic and dramatic series of incidents likely to be met in service and civilian life, where exhaled air resuscitation may be the quickest or only way of saving life. Emphasises how important it is for the victims, once breathing has restarted, to be taken to hospital for further observations.

results.title: Closed chest and cardiac massage
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”.
The techniques of closed chest cardiac massage is demonstrated by instructor, and by means of animated diagrams. The need for correct technique is stressed, when the method is used, accompanied by exhaled air resuscitation in cases of cardiac arrest and respiratory failure. The hazards of careless of misdirected application are explained.

results.title: Clockworks
results.creator_credit: Kent Stetson, Niall Burnett and Points East Productions
results.brief_description: Story about a Down’s syndrome child who eventually finds useful part-time employment with a clock repairer. Raises issues surrounding prejudice against the employment of the disabled.

results.title: Cliff hanging moments from the serials
results.brief_description: A selection of three trailers from the 1920s motion picture serials and feature films: 1. The 15 chapter serial “The Steel Trail” (1923), starring William Duncan and Edith Johnson. 2. The 15 chapter serial “Captain Kidd” (1922) starring Eddie Polo. 3. “A Woman in grey” (1920) starring Arline Pretty and Henry G. Sell

results.title: Clean waters
results.creator_credit: Raphael Wolff and Raphael G. Wolff Studios
results.brief_description: This film is a variation of another film of the same title (307748). It contains the same message, but different images, of the function of water in everyday life. Fish, game, livestock, and human beings must have clean water - polluted water brings death. Public health is endangered, recreational facilities are limited, the productivity of streams and lakes decreased, and property values fall disastrously when water is polluted or there is danger of pollution. “Clean Waters” gives a very interesting account of two American sewage treatment methods which prevent pollution of water.
